events.name: Toronto Blue Jays at Baltimore Orioles

headlines.description: — Adley Rutschman's two-run homer in the bottom of the ninth inning gave Baltimore a 3-2 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Wednesday, enabling the Orioles — yet again — to avoid a sweep.
headlines.shortLinkText: Adley Rutschman's 2-run homer in bottom of the 9th helps Orioles avoid sweep in 3-2 win over Toronto

video.headline: Adley Rutschman clubs walk-off HR for the Orioles

tracking.trackingName: MLB_One-Play (Adley Rutschman clubs walk-off HR for the Orioles) 2024/05/15 ESHEET

headlines.description: — Bryan De La Cruz homered, Trevor Rogers pitched five scoreless innings and the Miami Marlins beat the Detroit Tigers 2-0 on Wednesday afternoon.
headlines.shortLinkText: Trevor Rogers and the Marlins bullpen shut out the Tigers for the second straight day in a 2-0 win

video.headline: Bryan De La Cruz crushes a HR to put Marlins on the board

tracking.trackingName: MLB_One-Play (Bryan De La Cruz crushes a HR to put Marlins on the board) 2024/5/15 ESHEET

headlines.description: — William Contreras went 3 for 5 with four RBI and hit one of Milwaukee’s five homers off Martín Pérez in the Brewers’ 10-2 blowout of the Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: William Contreras leads the way as Brewers hit 5 homers off Martín Pérez in 10-2 win over Pirates

video.headline: Brewers have a HR derby off Pirates starter Martin Perez

events.name: Washington Nationals at Chicago White Sox

headlines.description: — Korey Lee went 3 for 3 with an RBI, Garrett Crochet tossed five scoreless innings and the Chicago White Sox topped the Washington Nationals 2-0 on Wednesday for their second straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: White Sox blank Nationals 2-0 for their 2nd consecutive win

video.headline: Nats' fielding error leads to White Sox run

tracking.trackingName: MLB_One-Play (Nats' fielding error leads to White Sox run) 2024/5/15 ESHEET

headlines.description: — Brandon Pfaadt threw seven stellar innings, Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth and the Arizona Diamondbacks beat the Cincinnati Reds 2-1 on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hits go-ahead RBI double in eighth to lead Diamondbacks over Reds 2-1

video.headline: Christian Walker wallops HR in 2nd inning for D-backs

tracking.trackingName: MLB_One-Play (Christian Walker wallops HR in 2nd inning for D-backs) 2024/05/16 ESHEET

events.name: Colorado Rockies at San Diego Padres

headlines.description: — Austin Gomber allowed two hits in six innings, Brenton Doyle and Jordan Beck homered and the Colorado Rockies beat the San Diego Padres 8-0 on Wednesday to complete a three-game sweep with their seventh straight victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gomber and Beck lead Rockies past Padres 8-0 for 3-game sweep and 7-game win streak

video.headline: Jordan Beck slams first career HR for Rockies

tracking.trackingName: MLB_One-Play (Jordan Beck slams first career HR for Rockies) 2024/05/15 ESHEET

events.name: Kansas City Royals at Seattle Mariners

headlines.description: — Ty France homered for the second time in three games, Bryan Woo allowed one run over 5 1/3 innings for his first win and the Seattle Mariners beat the Kansas City Royals 4-2 on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ty France homers, Bryan Woo picks up his first win and the Mariners beat the Royals 4-2

video.headline: Luke Raley's RBI pads Mariners' lead in the 8th

events.name: New York Mets at Philadelphia Phillies

headlines.description: — Bryce Harper homered, doubled and drove in three runs, unbeaten Ranger Suárez became the first eight-game winner in the majors and the streaking Philadelphia Phillies defeated the New York Mets 10-5 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Harper homers in return, Suárez improves to MLB-best 8-0 as streaking Phillies beat Mets 10-5

video.headline: Bryce Harper drills an opposite-field solo HR

events.name: Tampa Bay Rays at Boston Red Sox

headlines.description: — Yandy Díaz snapped a sixth-inning tie with a two-run single and the Tampa Bay Rays held off the Boston Red Sox 4-3 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Díaz's 2-run single in 6th sends Rays to 4-3 win over Red Sox at Fenway

headlines.description: — Javier Assad pitched six shutout innings and the Chicago Cubs avoided being swept for the first time this season by beating the Atlanta Braves 7-1 on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Javier Assad shuts down Braves as Cubs roll to 7-1 win in series finale

events.name: New York Yankees at Minnesota Twins

headlines.shortLinkText: Judge power fuels Yankees in 4-0 win over Twins as slugger hits 3rd-deck homer and 3 doubles

headlines.description: — Jon Gray pitched four-hit ball into the seventh inning and the Texas Rangers got two-run homers from Marcus Semien and Adolis García to beat the Cleveland Guardians 4-0 on Wednesday night, stopping a five-game losing streak.
headlines.shortLinkText: Another stellar start from Jon Gray leads Rangers past Guardians 4-0 to end 5-game losing streak

headlines.description: — Framber Valdez struck out eight in seven strong innings and combined with Seth Martinez for a two-hitter, and the Houston Astros beat the Oakland Athletics 3-0 on Wednesday for their season-high fourth straight victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Valdez strikes out eight in seven innings, Astros limit A's to two hits in 3-0 victory

events.name: St. Louis Cardinals at Los Angeles Angels

headlines.description: — Griffin Canning pitched six innings of one-run ball, Nolan Schanuel hit his first career leadoff homer and the Los Angeles Angels snapped their three-game skid with a 7-2 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Wednesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Angels hit 3 homers and salvage their homestand finale by beating Cardinals 7-2

events.name: Los Angeles Dodgers at San Francisco Giants

headlines.description: — Logan Webb pitched six scoreless innings and Mike Yastrzemski hit a two-run homer as the San Francisco Giants beat the Los Angeles Dodgers 4-1 on Wednesday night to avoid a three-game sweep.
headlines.shortLinkText: Yastrzemski homers and Webb pitches the Giants past the Dodgers 4-1
